required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on August 12, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Remdesivir Plus Tocilizumab Compared With Remdesivir Plus Placebo in Hospitalized Participants With Severe COVID-19 Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Remdesivir Plus Tocilizumab Compared With Remdesivir Plus Placebo in Hospitalized Patients With Severe COVID-19 Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of combination therapy with remdesivir plus tocilizumab compared with remdesivir plus placebo in hospitalized patients with COVID-19 pneumonia.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Hospital Discharge or "Ready for Discharge" up to Day 28
primary_outcome.description: Defined as days from randomization to hospital discharge or "Ready for Discharge" not followed by ordinal scale category >1, hospital readmission or death. Hospital discharge or "Ready for Discharge" is defined as an ordinal score of 1 on the 7-point ordinal scale. Participants who die are censored at Day 28. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Mechanical Ventilation or Death up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Mechanical Ventilation or Death defined as the time from randomization to the first occurrence of death or mechanical ventilation. For participants already on mechanical ventilation at baseline, only death is counted as an event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Death up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Time to death is defined as the time from randomization to death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Death up to Day 60
secondary_outcome.description: Time to death is defined as the time from randomization to death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Improvement of at Least 2 Categories Relative to Baseline on a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as time from randomization to the time when at least a 2-category improvement in the 7-category ordinal scale is observed. Patients who die are censored at day 28. Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 60
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Requiring Initiation of Mechanical Ventilation Post-baseline (Participants Who Did Not Require Mechanical Ventilation at Baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Day 28: Participants who withdraw or die prior to Day 28 are assumed to have required mechanical ventilation. Participants without mechanical ventilation prior to discharge are assumed not to have required mechanical ventilation unless they die by Day 28, which are counted as an event. Day 60: Participants who withdraw or die prior to Day 60 are assumed to have required mechanical ventilation. Participants without mechanical ventilation prior to discharge are assumed not to have required mechanical ventilation unless they die by Day 60, which are counted as an event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Are Alive and Free of Respiratory Failure at Day 28 and Day 60 (Participants Requiring Mechanical Ventilation at Baseline)
Duration of Mechanical Ventilation (Participants Requiring Mechanical Ventilation at Baseline) up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who die by Day 28 are assigned a duration of 28 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Mortality at Days 14, 28, and 60
Time to Recovery up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from randomization to the time when an ordinal scale category of 2 (non-ICU hospital ward or "ready for hospital ward" not requiring supplemental oxygen) or better is observed, not followed by ordinal scale category >2 or death. Participants who die are censored at day 28. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Are Discharged or "Ready for Discharge" up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as hospital discharge or "Ready for Discharge" not followed by ordinal scale category >1, hospital readmission or death. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Require Initiation of Mechanical Ventilation Post-baseline or Die up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Participants already on mechanical ventilation at baseline are only counted as an event if death occurs.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Tabulated by Severity
other_outcome.description: AEs were reported according to the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE). Grade 1: Mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (ADL) Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated Grade 5: Death related to AE Participants are counted at the highest AE grade experienced.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Any Post-Treatment Infection

arm_group.description: Participants assigned to the RDV+TCZ arm will receive a 10-day treatment course of RDV, plus one infusion of TCZ on Day 1.
Participants assigned to the RDV+ placebo arm will receive a 10-day treatment course of RDV, plus one infusion of TCZ-placebo on Day 1.

intervention.description: Participants will receive IV placebo matched to TCZ

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Hospitalized with COVID-19 pneumonia confirmed per a positive polymerase chain reaction (PCR) of any specimen (e.g., respiratory, blood, urine, stool, other bodily fluid) and evidenced by chest X-ray or CT scan
- Requiring more than 6 L/min supplemental oxygen to maintain SpO2 > 93%
- Agrees to not participate in another clinical trial for the treatment of COVID-19 while participating in this study
Exclusion Criteria
- Known severe allergic reactions to tocilizumab or other monoclonal antibodies
- Known hypersensitivity to remdesivir, the metabolites, or formulation excipients
- Active tuberculosis (TB) infection
- Suspected active bacterial, fungal, viral, or other infection (besides COVID-19)
- In the opinion of the investigator, progression to death is imminent and inevitable within the next 24 hours, irrespective of the provision of treatments
- Treatment with immunosuppressive or immunomodulatory therapy (including tocilizumab) within the past 3 months
- Concurrent treatment with other agents with actual or possible direct-acting antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 within 24 hours prior to study drug dosing. In addition, participants with prior or current treatment with > 2 doses of remdesivir for COVID-19 are excluded
- Participating in other drug clinical trials
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 30 mL/min (including patients receiving hemodialysis or hemofiltration)
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) > 5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) detected within 24 hours of screening (according to local laboratory reference ranges)
- Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) < 1000/uL at screening
- Platelet count < 50,000/uL at screening
- Body weight < 40 kg
- Treatment with an investigational drug within 5 half-lives or 30 days (whichever is longer) of randomization

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers may request access to individual patient level data through the clinical study data request platform (www.vivli.org). Further details on Roche's criteria for eligible studies are available here (https://vivli.org/ourmember/roche/). For further details on Roche's Global Policy on the Sharing of Clinical Information and how to request access to related clinical study documents, see here (https://www.roche.com/research_and_development/who_we_are_how_we_work/clinical_trials/our_commitment_to_data_sharing.htm).

group.title: Remdesivir + Placebo (RDV+PBO)
group.description: Participants were to receive a 200 mg intravenous (IV) loading dose of RDV, followed by one infusion of PBO on Day 1. Participants were then to be given a 100 mg once daily IV maintenance dose of RDV from Days 2-10, with discontinuation at discharge whether or not 10 days of RDV dosing were completed. One additional infusion of PBO was allowed 8-24 hours after the first for participants with sustained fever or clinically significant worsening of signs or symptoms.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ)
group.description: Participants were to receive a 200 mg intravenous (IV) loading dose of RDV, followed by one infusion of TCZ on Day 1. Participants were then to be given a 100 mg once daily IV maintenance dose of RDV from Days 2-10, with discontinuation at discharge whether or not 10 days of RDV dosing were completed. One additional infusion of TCZ was allowed 8-24 hours after the first for participants with sustained fever or clinically significant worsening of signs or symptoms.

One additional infusion of PBO was allowed 8-24 hours after the first for participants with sustained fever or clinically significant worsening of signs or symptoms.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ)
group.description: Participants were to receive a 200 mg intravenous (IV) loading dose of RDV, followed by one infusion of TCZ on Day 1. Participants were then to be given a 100 mg once daily IV maintenance dose of RDV from Days 2-10, with discontinuation at discharge whether or not 10 days of RDV dosing were completed. One additional infusion of TCZ was allowed 8-24 hours after the first for participants with sustained fever or clinically significant worsening of signs or symptoms.

group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.title: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 28
measure.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death
measure.population: Two participants in the RDV+TCZ arm had no post-baseline clinical status data to Day 28 and were excluded from analysis for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Clinical Status as Assessed by the Investigator Using a 7-category Ordinal Scale of Clinical Status on Day 60
outcome.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death
outcome.population: Two participants in the RDV+TCZ arm had no post-baseline clinical status data to Day 60 and were excluded from analysis for this endpoint.

group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ) - mITT Population
group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.description: Clinical status was assessed by the investigator according to the following ordinal scale categories: Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death
measure.population: Two participants in the RDV+TCZ arm had no post-baseline clinical status data to Day 60 and were excluded from analysis for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Requiring Initiation of Mechanical Ventilation Post-baseline (Participants Who Did Not Require Mechanical Ventilation at Baseline)
outcome.description: Day 28: Participants who withdraw or die prior to Day 28 are assumed to have required mechanical ventilation. Participants without mechanical ventilation prior to discharge are assumed not to have required mechanical ventilation unless they die by Day 28, which are counted as an event. Day 60: Participants who withdraw or die prior to Day 60 are assumed to have required mechanical ventilation. Participants without mechanical ventilation prior to discharge are assumed not to have required mechanical ventilation unless they die by Day 60, which are counted as an event.
outcome.population: The analysis population for this endpoint included only participants not on mechanical ventilation at baseline

group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.description: Day 28: Participants who withdraw or die prior to Day 28 are assumed to have required mechanical ventilation. Day 60: Participants who withdraw or die prior to Day 60 are assumed to have required mechanical ventilation. Participants without mechanical ventilation prior to discharge are assumed not to have required mechanical ventilation unless they die by Day 60, which are counted as an event.
measure.population: The analysis population for this endpoint included only participants not on mechanical ventilation at baseline

outcome.description: Participants who die by Day 28 are assigned a duration of 28 days.
outcome.population: The analysis population for this endpoint included only participants on mechanical ventilation at baseline.

measure.title: Difference in Mortality at Days 14, 28, and 60

outcome.title: Time to Recovery up to Day 28
outcome.description: Defined as the time from randomization to the time when an ordinal scale category of 2 (non-ICU hospital ward or "ready for hospital ward" not requiring supplemental oxygen) or better is observed, not followed by ordinal scale category >2 or death. Participants who die are censored at day 28. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ) - mITT Population
group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.title: Time to Recovery up to Day 28
measure.description: Defined as the time from randomization to the time when an ordinal scale category of 2 (non-ICU hospital ward or "ready for hospital ward" not requiring supplemental oxygen) or better is observed, not followed by ordinal scale category >2 or death. Participants who die are censored at day 28. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Who Are Discharged or "Ready for Discharge" up to Day 28
outcome.description: Defined as hospital discharge or "Ready for Discharge" not followed by ordinal scale category >1, hospital readmission or death. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.title: Proportion of Participants Who Are Discharged or "Ready for Discharge" up to Day 28
measure.description: Defined as hospital discharge or "Ready for Discharge" not followed by ordinal scale category >1, hospital readmission or death. Discharged (or "ready for discharge" as evidenced by normal temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or </= 2L supplemental oxygen) Non-intensive care unit (ICU) hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") not requiring supplemental oxygen Non-ICU hospital ward (or "ready for hospital ward") requiring supplemental oxygen ICU or non-ICU hospital ward, requiring non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen ICU, requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation ICU, requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or mechanical ventilation and additional organ support (e.g., vasopressors, renal replacement therapy) Death

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Who Require Initiation of Mechanical Ventilation Post-baseline or Die up to Day 28
outcome.description: Participants already on mechanical ventilation at baseline are only counted as an event if death occurs.

group.title: Remdesivir + Placebo (RDV+PBO) - mITT Population
group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ) - mITT Population
group.description: The mITT population included all randomized participants who received any amount of TCZ or placebo (PBO), with participants grouped according to treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.title: Proportion of Participants Who Require Initiation of Mechanical Ventilation Post-baseline or Die up to Day 28
measure.description: Participants already on mechanical ventilation at baseline are only counted as an event if death occurs.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Tabulated by Severity
outcome.description: AEs were reported according to the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE). Grade 1: Mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (ADL) Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated Grade 5: Death related to AE Participants are counted at the highest AE grade experienced.
outcome.population: Participants that only received RDV and did not receive TCZ/PBO were included in the RDV+PBO arm of the safety population.

group.title: Remdesivir + Placebo (RDV+PBO) - Safety Population
group.description: The safety population included all participants who received any amount of study medication (RDV and/or TCZ/PBO), with participants grouped according to the actual treatment received rather than the treatment assigned at randomization.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ) - Safety Population
group.description: The safety population included all participants who received any amount of study medication (RDV and/or TCZ/PBO), with participants grouped according to the actual treatment received rather than the treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Tabulated by Severity
measure.description: AEs were reported according to the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE). Grade 1: Mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (ADL) Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated Grade 5: Death related to AE Participants are counted at the highest AE grade experienced.
measure.population: Participants that only received RDV and did not receive TCZ/PBO were included in the RDV+PBO arm of the safety population.

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants With Any Post-Treatment Infection
outcome.population: Participants that only received RDV and did not receive TCZ/PBO were included in the RDV+PBO arm of the safety population.

group.title: Remdesivir + Placebo (RDV+PBO) - Safety Population
group.description: The safety population included all participants who received any amount of study medication (RDV and/or TCZ/PBO), with participants grouped according to the actual treatment received rather than the treatment assigned at randomization.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ) - Safety Population
group.description: The safety population included all participants who received any amount of study medication (RDV and/or TCZ/PBO), with participants grouped according to the actual treatment received rather than the treatment assigned at randomization.

measure.title: Proportion of Participants With Any Post-Treatment Infection
measure.population: Participants that only received RDV and did not receive TCZ/PBO were included in the RDV+PBO arm of the safety population.

reported_events.desc: The safety analysis population consisted of all participants who received any amount of study medication (RDV and/or TCZ/PBO). Participants were grouped according to the treatment received rather than by the treatment assigned at randomization. Participants that only received RDV and did not receive TCZ/PBO were included in the RDV+PBO arm of the safety population.

group.title: Remdesivir + Placebo (RDV+PBO)
group.description: Participants were to receive a 200 mg intravenous (IV) loading dose of RDV, followed by one infusion of PBO on Day 1. Participants were then to be given a 100 mg once daily IV maintenance dose of RDV from Days 2-10, with discontinuation at discharge whether or not 10 days of RDV dosing were completed. One additional infusion of PBO was allowed 8-24 hours after the first for participants with sustained fever or clinically significant worsening of signs or symptoms.

group.title: Remdesivir + Tocilizumab (RDV+TCZ)
group.description: Participants were to receive a 200 mg intravenous (IV) loading dose of RDV, followed by one infusion of TCZ on Day 1. Participants were then to be given a 100 mg once daily IV maintenance dose of RDV from Days 2-10, with discontinuation at discharge whether or not 10 days of RDV dosing were completed. One additional infusion of TCZ was allowed 8-24 hours after the first for participants with sustained fever or clinically significant worsening of signs or symptoms.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
